feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Stormy Week Ahead... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Yukon Delta Friday afternoon. Snowfall with this system will move north and east Friday evening into Saturday and will bring 3-8 inches of snow south of the Bering Strait Friday afternoon into Saturday morning, with 1-4 inches north of the Bering Strait
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow and Periods of Moderate Snow for the Seward Highway... Motorists traveling through Portage Valley and into Whittier should expect moderate snow this afternoon and evening. A developing front will push into Prince William Sound as we head through the day. Along with steady snow, this system will bring

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 16 at 3:49AM AKST until December 16 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with low visibility occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches are expected. Visibility will be one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 16 at 2:57AM AKST until December 16 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Cold wind chills as low as 60 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 2:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Possible Early Next Week... Heavy snowfall is possible Sunday night into Tuesday across the Central and Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. This weather system also has the potential to bring gusty winds to the area, along with freezing rain. There is still a lot of uncertainty with the exact details of this

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE FRIDAY FOR SOUTHERN PANHANDLE... A system could bring accumulating snow to the Southern Panhandle and parts of the outer coastal areas, from Port Alexander south, on Friday. Some scenarios offer the possibility of 3-5 inches of snowfall accumulation during this time. However, an anticipated southerly wind push could bring in warmer air and result in a
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 16 at 12:07PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLD WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE FORMATION ON THE MISSOURI RIVER... With another stretch of cold temperatures in store through the weekend and into next week, it appears that the Missouri River is making another attempt to initiate ice along the Burleigh and Morton counties reach of the river. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 6:56PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another Round of Snow through Thursday... A system swinging through the Great Basin will bring light snow to the area late Wednesday night into Thursday. Generally around an inch or less expected in the valleys, with mountains seeing 1 to 4 inches.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 7:32AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Light Snow Today into Friday Morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow. Accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. * WHERE...The Jackson and Star Valleys. * WHEN...This morning through Friday morning.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 4:57AM MST until December 17 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park, Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 3:23AM MST until December 17 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches expected, with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre mountain ranges. * WHEN...5 PM MST Today until 8 AM MST Friday.
